questions.prompt: In BG 10.1, what does Krishna offer to reveal to Arjuna?
choices: My divine opulences and how I am the source of all
questions.feedback: Krishna reveals His transcendental nature and all-pervading power.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.2, what is the source of understanding Krishna?
choices: Neither the demigods nor great saints know my origin; I am the source of all
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate source; His nature is beyond external knowledge.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.3, what characterizes one who truly knows Krishna?
choices: Free from delusion and all sin; fully devoted to me
questions.feedback: True knowledge of Krishna purifies consciousness completely.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.4-5 teach about Krishna's divine manifestations?
choices: From me come intellect, knowledge, freedom from doubt, forgiveness, truth, self-control
questions.feedback: All divine qualities originate from Krishna's supreme nature.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.8, what is Krishna's fundamental assertion?
choices: I am the source of all creation; everything flows from me; all is resting in me
questions.feedback: Krishna states that He is the ultimate source of all creation. Everything emanates from Him, and all rest upon His potency. Nothing exists independently of Him. This fundamental truth establishes Krishna's absolute supremacy as the creator and sustainer of the cosmos.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.10, what does Krishna promise to those absorbed in Him?
choices: I grant them the intelligence to attain me
questions.feedback: Those devoted to Krishna receive divine intelligence to know Him.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.11 teach about Krishna's compassion?
choices: I destroy the darkness of ignorance with the light of transcendental knowledge
questions.feedback: Krishna's compassionate enlightenment destroys ignorance completely.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.13, how is Krishna addressed by great authorities?
choices: Brahma, Shiva, and all sages declare me as the Supreme Truth
questions.feedback: All great spiritual authorities recognize Krishna as the Supreme.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.14, what does Krishna claim to know?
choices: All my divine manifestations and opulences; all virtues abide in me
questions.feedback: Krishna possesses complete knowledge of all divine qualities.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.15 teach about knowing Krishna fully?
choices: One who knows me in all aspects attains eternal peace
questions.feedback: Complete knowledge of Krishna grants eternal peace and fulfillment.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.20, what is Krishna's declaration about His nature?
choices: I am the self seated in the heart of all; I am the beginning, middle, and end
questions.feedback: Krishna's presence pervades and sustains the entire creation.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.21, what example does Krishna give of His opulences in the material world?
choices: Among all elements, I am fire; among the Vedas, I am OM
questions.feedback: Krishna manifests His divine power through all creation.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.22 teach about the highest of Krishna's manifestations?
choices: There is nothing higher than me; all rests on me as pearls on a thread
questions.feedback: Krishna is the supreme foundation of all existence.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.23, who among great personalities is the foremost?
choices: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; I am superior to all
questions.feedback: Krishna is supreme among all divine manifestations.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.24, what is Krishna among the senses?
choices: Among all senses, I am the mind; I am the life in all beings
questions.feedback: Krishna is the source of consciousness and sensation in all beings.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.25 teach about Krishna among the celestial beings?
choices: Among celestial beings, I am Indra; I am the king
questions.feedback: Krishna is supreme even among the powerful demigods.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.26, what weapon represents Krishna?
choices: Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, I am Kamadhenu
questions.feedback: Krishna manifests His might through all powerful forces.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.27, what generation of the Yadavas is Krishna?
choices: He is not from this lineage
Among the Yadavas, I am Vasudeva; I am Krishna
questions.feedback: Krishna revealed His supreme position among His own kinsmen.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.28 teach about Krishna's function?
choices: I am the seed of all creation; none can exist without me
questions.feedback: Every atom of creation depends on Krishna's potency.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.29, what brings unlimited strength and power?
questions.feedback: Association with Krishna grants supreme power and strength.

questions.prompt: In the conclusion of Chapter 10, what is the central message?
choices: I am everything; all emanates from me; meditate on this
questions.feedback: Remembering Krishna's supreme nature is the path to all perfection.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.39, what should be the meditation of the devotee?
choices: Fix your mind upon Krishna; offer all to Him
questions.feedback: Exclusive focus on Krishna leads to the highest spiritual achievement.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.40, what is promised to those who meditate on Krishna?
choices: I am never not with you; there is no doubt of this
questions.feedback: Krishna's eternal presence with devoted souls is guaranteed.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.41 emphasize about Krishna's position?
choices: Whatever possesses splendor is my partial manifestation; all stands in me
questions.feedback: All glory, beauty, and power in existence reflects Krishna's nature.

questions.prompt: According to the concluding teaching of Chapter 10, what should one understand?
choices: Know that I am supreme; all beauty and power comes from my potency
questions.feedback: Understanding Krishna as supreme is the perfection of all knowledge.
